item.title: Krisha add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Krisha add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Begin at the beginning," the King said, very gravely, "and go on till you come to the end: then stop." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description:
"How doth the little crocodile Improve his shining tail, And pour the waters of the Nile On every golden scale!
How cheerfully he seems to grin, How neatly he spreads his claws, And welcomes little fishes in, With gently smiling jaws!" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "I'd give all the wealth that years have piled, the slow result of life's decay, To be once more a little child for one bright summer day." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "One of the deep secrets of life is that all that is really worth the doing is what we do for others." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "Well' Francie decided, 'I guess the thing that is giving me this headache is life - and nothing else but'." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Krisha add a quote by John Kennedy Toole
item.description: "The day before me is fraught with God knows what horrors." -- John Kennedy Toole

item.title: Krisha add a quote by John Kennedy Toole
item.description: "I am at the moment writing a lengthy indictment against our century. When my brain begins to reel from my literary labors, I make an occasional cheese dip." -- John Kennedy Toole

item.title: Krisha add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Oh, of course there's a risk in marrying anybody, but, when it's all said and done, there's many a worse thing than a husband." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "Life is worth living as long as there's a laugh in it." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Krisha add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "That's the worst of growing up, and I'm beginning to realize it. The things you wanted so much when you were a child don't seem half so wonderful to you when you get them." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Karen Thompson Walker
item.description: "But doesn't every precious era feel like fiction once it's gone? After a while, certain vestigial sayings are all that remain. Decades after the invention of the automobile, for instance, we continue to warn each other not to 'put the cart before the horse'. So, too, we do still have 'day'dreams and 'night'mares, and the early-morning clock hours are still known colloquially (if increasing mysteriously) as 'the crack of dawn'. Similarly, even as they grew apart, my parents never stopped calling each other 'sweetheart'." -- Karen Thompson Walker

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "We're all mad here." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Yes, that's it! Said the Hatter with a sigh, it's always tea time." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "The time has come The walrus said To talk of many things: Of shoes- and ships- And sealing wax- Of cabbages and kings- And why the sae is boiling hot- And whether pigs have wings." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "If I had a world of my own, everything would be nonsense." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Krisha add a quote by Elizabeth Gaskell
item.description: "He shook hands with Margaret. He knew it was the first time their hands had met, though she was perfectly unconscious of the fact." -- Elizabeth Gaskell

item.title: Krisha add a quote by L. M. Montgomery
item.description: "I'm so glad I live in a world where there are Octobers." -- L. M. Montgomery

item.title: Krisha add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "All i want is a dress with puffy sleaves" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Krisha add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Listen to the trees talking in their sleep,' she whispered, as he lifted her to the ground. 'What nice dreams they must have!" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Krisha add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it... Yet." -- L.M. Montgomery
